thread.title: Nats interested in Giants coach for managerial opening
thread.title_full: Nats interested in Giants coach for managerial opening

author: Henry Schulman
title: Nats interested in Giants coach for managerial opening
text:
Published 5:30 pm, Tuesday, October 13, 2015 Photo: Eric Risberg, Associated Press Image 1 of / 1 Close Image 1 of 1 
Giants bench coach Ron Wotus greets Rockies manager Walt Weiss before a game at AT&T Park. Photo: Eric Risberg, Associated Press Giants bench coach Ron Wotus greets Rockies manager Walt Weiss... Nats interested in Giants coach for managerial opening 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
The Washington Nationals , who fired manager Matt Williams after the season is over, have sought and received permission to interview longtime Giants manager bench coach Ron Wotus for the job, according to a major-league sources. 
Wotus, 54, has spent the past 18 seasons on the Giants' major-league staff and has managed for them in the minors. He has expressed an interesting in managing a major-league team, Bruce Bochy has applauded the idea and Wotus has interviewed for jobs in recent years. 
He reportedly was a semifinalist for the Pirates job during one of their searches. 
Wotus has not yet interviewed with the Nats. The Washington Post , which first reported their interest in Wotus, said the club has interviewed former Padres infielder Phil Nevin and also wants to talk to Bud Black , whom San Diego fired as manager midway through the 2015 season.
